Turn data into strategic decisions and boost your business results

content_blocks.subsection: Turn data into strategic decisions and boost your business results

content_blocks.text: Managers and decision-makers who wish to broaden their analytical knowledge of data, developing data-based projects capable of supporting strategic business decisions. Investment and payment method: R$13,900.00, cash at PIX or in installments up to 12x without interest *Date subject to change with prior notice
content_blocks.subsection: Turn data into strategic decisions and boost your business results

content_blocks.text: About the course:

The executive programData Science for Decision Makerswas developed with the aim of presenting techniques for analyzing and investigating data for decision making, with application for market professionals from various sectors.

In this program, students will learn about investigating problems and choosing the best data and models to start a project, techniques for descriptive data analysis, models and frameworks for data-based predictive analysis, as well as hypothesis testing and design of experiments to gaininsightsimportant insights for decision-making.
The content is covered using cases from renowned international universities and mediated by teachers with extensive experience in the market.
Topics covered in the course:
Module 1 - Diagnosis: Defining the Problem Module 2 - Descriptive Analysis: Investigating the Past Module 3 - Predictive Analysis: Inferring the Future Module 4 - Experimentation: Testing Changes
By the end of the course, you will be able to:
content_blocks.subsection: By the end of the course, you will be able to:

content_blocks.text:
By the end of the course, you will be able to:

- Apply heuristics and deal with possible data biases in the decision-making process
- Solving problems with exploratory data analysis
- Structuring data observations with visualization techniques
- Apply predictive models to make inferences about possible future results
- Develop experiments to validate hypotheses
